topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Monitoring the Mount Points using Icinga

body.p: The Icinga service, which runs in the undercloud, helps cloud admins monitor the mount point of all the swift nodes.

ul.li: HP Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed. (Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud

section.title: Monitoring Mount Points of Object Storage (Swift)
section.p: Ensure the correctness of mount points using Icinga.
Perform the following steps to monitor the mount points of Object Storage (Swift) disk:

li.p: In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:

Click Status on the left panel and then click
Host Detail
.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address > and displays the mount points
of the selected Swift node.

row.entry: These mount point are not mounted with the correct labels. These points do not have swift:swift permissions. These mount points are not mounted with read and write permissions. These mount points are not xfs .
Check all the mounted drives for permission and file systems correct labels.
